name: Abort
documentation: Stops execution of the action list.

name: Abort If
documentation: Stops execution of the action list if the actionвЂ™s condition evaluates to true, if it does not, the execution continues with the next action.

Condition.documentation: Specifies whether the execution is stopped. Can use most Boolean based Value Syntax.

name: Abort If Condition Is False
documentation: Stops execution of the action list if at least one condition in the condition list is false. If all conditions are true, execution continues with the next action.

name: Abort If Condition Is True
documentation: Stops execution of the action list if all conditions in the condition list is true. If any are false, execution continues with the next action.

name: Allow Button
documentation: Undoes the effect of the disallow button action for one or more players.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose button is being reenabled. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Button.documentation: The logical button that is being reenabled.

name: Big Message
documentation: Displays a large message above the reticle that is visible to specific players.

Visible To.documentation: One or more players who will see the message. Can use most Value Syntax to select multiple players to specify.

Header.documentation: The message to be displayed. Can use most String based Value Syntax to specify.

name: Chase Global Variable At Rate
documentation: Gradually modifies the value of a global variable at a specific rate. (A global variable is a variable that belongs to the game itself.)

Variable.documentation: The variable the action will manipulate. Can use most Variable based Value Syntax.

Destination.documentation: The value that the global variable will eventually reach. The type of this value may be either a number or a vector, through the variableвЂ™s existing value must be of the same type before the chase begins. Can use most Number or Vector based Value Syntax to specify.

Rate.documentation: The amount of change that will happen to the variableвЂ™s value each second. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to specify.

Reevaluation.documentation: Specifies which of this actionвЂ™s inputs will be continuously reevaluated. This action will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs. You can specify a Destination and Rate or nothing.

name: Chase Global Variable Over Time
documentation: Gradually modifies the value of a global variable over time. (A global variable is a variable that belongs to the game itself.)

Variable.documentation: The variable the action will manipulate. Can use most Variable based Value Syntax.

Destination.documentation: The value that the global variable will eventually reach. The type of this value may be either a number or a vector, through the variableвЂ™s existing value must be of the same type before the chase begins. Can use most Number or Vector based Value Syntax to specify.

Duration.documentation: The amount of time, in seconds, over which the variableвЂ™s value will approach the destination. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to specify.

Reevaluation.documentation: Specifies which of this actionвЂ™s inputs will be continuously reevaluated. This action will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs. You can specify a Destination and Duration or nothing.

name: Chase Player Variable At Rate
documentation: Gradually modifies the value of a player variable at a specific rate. (A player variable is a variable that belongs to a specific player.)

Player.documentation: The player whose variable will gradually change. If multiple players are provided, each of their variables will change independently.

Variable.documentation: The variable the action will manipulate. Can use most Variable based Value Syntax.

Destination.documentation: The value that the player variable will eventually reach. The type of this value may be either a number or a vector, through the variableвЂ™s existing value must be of the same type before the chase begins. Can use most Number or Vector based Value Syntax to specify.

Rate.documentation: The amount of change that will happen to the variableвЂ™s value each second. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to specify.

Reevaluation.documentation: Specifies which of this actionвЂ™s inputs will be continuously reevaluated. This action will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs. You can specify a Destination and Rate or nothing.

name: Chase Player Variable Over Time
documentation: Gradually modifies the value of a player variable over time. (A player variable is a variable that belongs to a specific player.)

Player.documentation: The player whose variable will gradually change. If multiple players are provided, each of their variables will change independently.

Variable.documentation: The variable the action will manipulate. Can use most Variable based Value Syntax.

Destination.documentation: The value that the player variable will eventually reach. The type of this value may be either a number or a vector, through the variableвЂ™s existing value must be of the same type before the chase begins. Can use most Number or Vector based Value Syntax to specify.

Duration.documentation: The amount of time, in seconds, over which the variableвЂ™s value will approach the destination. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to specify.

Reevaluation.documentation: Specifies which of this actionвЂ™s inputs will be continuously reevaluated. This action will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs. You can specify a Destination and Duration or nothing.

name: Clear Status
documentation: Clears a status that was applied from a set status action from one or more players.

Player.documentation: The player or players from whom the status will be removed. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Status.documentation: The Status to be removed from the player or players. Values include Hacked, Burning, Knocked Down, Asleep, Frozen, Unkillable, Invincible, Phased Out, Rooted, or Stunned.

name: Communicate
documentation: Causes one or more players to use an emote, voice line, or other equipped communication.

Player.documentation: The player or players to perform the communication. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Type.documentation: The type of communication. Can use any equipped emote, equipped voice line, or any other communication effect.

name: Create Beam Effect
documentation: Creates an in-world beam effect entity. This effect entity will persist until destroyed, to obtain a reference to this entity, use the last created entity value. This action will fail if too many entities have been created.

Visible To.documentation: One or more players who will be able to see the effect. Can use most Value Syntax to select one or multiple players.

Beam Type.documentation:
The type of the effect to be created.

Good Beam
Bad Beam
Grapple Beam

Start Position.documentation: The effectвЂ™s start position. If this value is a player, then the effect will move along with the player, otherwise, the value is interpreted as a position in the world. Can use most Player or Vector based Value Syntax.

End Position.documentation: The effectвЂ™s end position. If this value is a player, then the effect will move along with the player, otherwise, the value is interpreted as a position in the world. Can use most Player or Vector based Value Syntax.

Color.documentation: The color of the beam effect to be created. IF a particular team is chosen, the effect will either be red or blue, depending on whether the team is hostile to the viewer. Does not apply to sound effects.

Reevaluation.documentation:
Specifies which of this actionвЂ™s inputs will be continuously reevaluated, the effect will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs.

Visible to, position, and radius
Position and radius
Visible to
None

name: Create Dummy Bot
documentation: Adds a new bot to the specified slot on the specified team so long as the slot is available. This bot will only move, fire, or use abilities if executing Workshop actions.

Hero.documentation: The hero that the bot will be. If more than one hero is provided, one will be chosen at random.

Team.documentation: The team on which to create the bot. The вЂњALLвЂќ option only works in Free-For-All game modes, while the вЂњTEAMвЂќ options only work in team-based game modes.

Slot.documentation: The player slot which will receive the bot (-1 for first available slot). Up to 6 bots may be added to each team, or 12 bots to the Free-For-All team, regardless of lobby settings.

Position.documentation: The initial position where the bot will appear.

Facing.documentation: The initial direction where the bot will face.

name: Create Effect
documentation: Creates an in-world effect entity. This effect entity will persist until destroyed, to obtain a reference to this entity, use the last created entity value. This action will fail if too many entities have been created.

Visible To.documentation: One or more players who will be able to see the effect. Can use most Value Syntax to select one or multiple players.

Type.documentation:
The type of the effect to be created.

Sphere
Light Shaft
Orb
Ring
Cloud
Sparkles
Good Aura
Bad Aura
Energy Sound
Pick-Up Sound
Good Aura Sound
Bad Aura Sound
Sparkles Sound
Smoke Sound
Decal Sound
Beacon Sound

Color.documentation: The color of the effect to be created. IF a particular team is chosen, the effect will either be red or blue, depending on whether the team is hostile to the viewer. Does not apply to sound effects.

Position.documentation: The effectвЂ™s position. If this value is a player, then the effect will move along with the player, otherwise, the value is interpreted as a position in the world. Can use most Player or Vector based Value Syntax.

Radius.documentation: The effectвЂ™s radius in meters. Sound effects have their volume affected instead.

Reevaluation.documentation:
Specifies which of this actionвЂ™s inputs will be continuously reevaluated, the effect will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs.

Visible to, position, and scale
Position and scale
Visible to
None

name: Create HUD Text
documentation: Creates HUD text visible to specific players at specific location on the screen. This text will persist until destroyed. To obtain a reference to this text, use the last text ID value. This action will fail if too many text elements have been created.

Visible To.documentation: One or more players who will see the HUD text. Can use most Value Syntax to select one or multiple players.

Header.documentation: The header text to be displayed (can be blank). Can use most String based Value Syntax to populate.

Subheader.documentation: The subheader text to be displayed (can be blank). Can use most String based Value Syntax to populate.

Text.documentation: The body text to be displayed (can be blank). Can use most String based Value Syntax to populate.

Location.documentation: The location on the screen where text will appear. You can choose left, top, or right.

Sort Order.documentation: The Sort Order of the text relative to other text in the same location. Text with a higher sort order will come after text with a lower sort order. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

Header Color.documentation: The color of the Header text to be created. If a particular team is chosen, the effect will either be red or blue.

Subheader Color.documentation: The color of the Subheader text to be created. If a particular team is chosen, the effect will either be red or blue.

Text Color.documentation: The color of the body text to be created. If a particular team is chosen, the effect will either be red or blue.

Reevaluation.documentation:
Specifies which of this actionвЂ™s inputs will be continuously reevaluated, the text will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs.

Visible to and String
String
None

name: Create Icon
documentation: Creates an in-world entity. This icon entity will persist until destroyed. To obtain a reference to this entity, use the last created entity value. This action will fail if too many entities have been created.

Visible To.documentation: One or more players who will be able to see the icon. Can use most Value Syntax to select one or multiple players.

Position.documentation: The iconвЂ™s position. If this value is a player, then the icon will appear above the playerвЂ™s head, otherwise, the value is interpreted as a position in the world. Can use most Player or Vector based Value Syntax.

Icon.documentation:
The icon to be created.

Arrow: Down
Arrow: Left
Arrow: Right
Arrow: Up
Asterisk
Bolt
Checkmark
Circle
Club
Diamond
Dizzy
Exclamation Mark
Eye
Fire
Flag
Halo
Happy
Heart
Moon
No
Plus
Poison
Poison 2
Question Mark
Radioactive
Recycle
Ring Thick
Ring Thin
Sad
Skull
Spade
Spiral
Stop
Trashcan
Warning
X

Reevaluation.documentation:
Specifies which of this actionвЂ™s inputs will be continously reevaluated, the icon will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs.

Visible to and position
Position
Visible to
None

Icon Color.documentation: The color of the icon to be created. IF a particular team is chosen, the icon will either be red or blue, depending on whether the team is hostile to the viewer.

Show When Offscreen.documentation: Should this icon still appear even when it is behind you? Can use most Boolean based Value Syntax to specify.

name: Create In-World Text
documentation: Creates in-world text visible to specific players at specific position in the world. This text will persist until destroyed. To obtain a reference to this text, use the last text ID value. This action will fail if too many text elements have been created.

Visible To.documentation: One or more players who will see the HUD text. Can use most Value Syntax to select one or multiple players.

Header.documentation: The header text to be displayed (can be blank). Can use most String based Value Syntax to populate.

Position.documentation: The textвЂ™s position. If this value is a player, then the text will appear above the playerвЂ™s head. Otherwise, the value is interpreted as a position in the world. Can use most Player or Vector based Value Syntax.

Scale.documentation: The textвЂ™s scale. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

Clipping.documentation:
Specifies whether the text can be seen through walls or is instead clipped.

Clip Against Surfaces - The text may be partially or completely obscured by walls, floors, ceilings, players, or other solid objects.
Do not clip - The text will always be fully visible. Even if it is behind a wall or solid object.

Reevaluation.documentation:
Specifies which of this actionвЂ™s inputs will be continuously reevaluated, the text will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs.

Visible to, Position, and String
Visible to and String
None

name: Damage
documentation: Applies instantaneous damage to one or more players, possibly killing the players.

Player.documentation: The player or players who will receive damage. Can use most Player based Value Syntax to select one or multiple players.

Damager.documentation: The player who will receive credit for the damage. A damager of null indicates no player will receive credit. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Amount.documentation: The amount of damage to apply. This amount may be modified by buffs, debuffs, or armor. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

name: Declare Match Draw
documentation: Instantly ends the match in a draw. This action has no effect in free-for-all modes.

name: Declare Player Victory
documentation: Instantly ends the match with the specific player as the winner. This action only has an effect in free-for-all modes.

Player.documentation: The winning player. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

name: Declare Round Victory
documentation: Declare a team as the current round winner. This only works in the control and elimination game modes.

name: Declare team Victory
documentation: Instantly ends the match with the specified team as the winner. This action has no effect in free-for-all modes.

Team.documentation: The winning team. Can use most Team based Value Syntax for this value.

name: Destroy All Dummy Bots
documentation: Removes all dummy bots from the match.

name: Destroy All Effects
documentation: Destroys all effect entities created by create effect.

name: Destroy All Icons
documentation: Destroys all icon entities created by create icon.

name: Destroy All In-World Text
documentation: Destroys all in-world text created by the create in-world effect.

name: Destroy Dummy Bot
documentation: Removes the specified dummy bot from the match.

Team.documentation: The team to remove the dummy bot from. The вЂњALLвЂќ option only works in Free-For-All game modes, while the вЂњTEAMвЂќ options only work in team-based game modes.

Slot.documentation: The slot to remove the dummy bot from.

name: Destroy Effect
documentation: Destroys an effect entity that was created by create effect.

name: Destroy HUD Text
documentation: Destroys hud text that was created by create hud text.

Text ID.documentation: Specifies which hud text to destroy. This ID may be last text ID or a variable into which last text ID was earlier stored.

name: Disable Built-In Game Mode Announcer
documentation: Disables game mode announcements from the announcer until reenabled or the match ends.

name: Disable Built-In Game Mode Completion
documentation: Disables completion of the match from the game mode itself, only allowing the match to be completed by scripting commands.

name: Disable Built-In Game Mode Music
documentation: Disables all game-mode music until reenabled or the match ends.

name: Disable Built-In Game Mode Respawning
documentation: Disables automatic respawning for one or more players, only allowing respawning by scripting commands.

name: Disable Built-In Game Mode Scoring
documentation: Disables changes to player and team scores from the game mode itself, only allowing scores to be changed by scripting commands.

name: Disable Death Spectate All Players
documentation: Undoes the effect of the enable death spectate all players action for one or more players.

name: Disable Death Spectate Target HUD
documentation: Undoes the effect of the enable death spectate target hud action for one or more players.

name: Disallow Button
documentation: Disables a logical button for one or more players such that pressing it has no effect.

Player.documentation: The player executing this rule, as specified by the event. May be the same as the attacker or victim. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

name: Enable Built-In Game Mode Announcer
documentation: Undoes the effect of the disable built-in game mode announcer action.

name: Enable Built-In Game Mode Completion
documentation: Undoes the effect of the disable built-in game mode completion action.

name: Enable Built-In Game Mode Music
documentation: Undoes the effect of the disable built-in game mode music action.

name: Enable Built-In Game Mode Respawning
documentation: Undoes the effect of the disable built-in game mode respawning for one or more players.

name: Enable Built-In Game Mode Scoring
documentation: Undoes the effect of the disable built-in game mode scoring action.

name: Enable Death Spectate All Players
documentation: Allows one or more players to spectate all players when dead, as opposed to only allies.

name: Enable Death Spectate Target HUD
documentation: Allows one or more players to see their targetвЂ™s HUD when dead instead of their own while death spectating.

name: Go To Assemble Heroes
documentation: Go to the assemble heroes phase of the game mode. Only works if a game is in progress.

name: Heal
documentation: Provides an instantaneous heal to one or more players. This heal will not resurrect dead players.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose health will be restored. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Healer.documentation: The player who will receive credit for the healing. A healer of null indicates no player will receive credit. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Amount.documentation: The amount of healing to apply. This amount may be modified by buffs or debuffs, healing is capped by each playerвЂ™s max health. Can use most Number based Value Syntax for this value.

name: Kill
documentation: Instantly kills one or more players.

Player.documentation: The player or players who will be killed. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Killer.documentation: The player who will receive credit for the kill. A killer of null indicates no player will receive credit. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

name: Loop
documentation: Restarts the action list from the beginning. To prevent an infinite loop, a wait action must execute between the start of the action list and this action.

name: Loop If
documentation: Restarts the action list from the beginning if this actionвЂ™s condition evaluates to true. If it does not, execution continues with the next action. To prevent an infinite loop, a wait action must execute between the start of the action list and this action.

Condition.documentation: Specifies whether the loop will occur. Can use most Conditional based Value Syntax for this value.

name: Modify Global Variable
documentation: Modifies the value of a global variable, which is a variable that belongs to the game itself.

Variable.documentation: Variable specified by a single alphabetic letter (A through Z).

Operation.documentation: The way in which the variableвЂ™s value will be changed. Options include standard arithmetic operations as well as array operations for appending and removing values.

Value.documentation: The value used for the modification. For arithmetic operations, this is the second of two operands, with the other being the variableвЂ™s existing value. For array operations, this is the value to append or remove. Various Value Syntax can be used.

name: Modify Global Variable At Index
documentation: Modifies the value of a global variable at an index, which is a variable that belongs to the game itself.

Variable.documentation: Variable specified by a single alphabetic letter (A through Z).

Index.documentation: The index of the array to modify. If the index is beyond the end of the array, the array is extended with new elements given a value of 0.

Operation.documentation: The way in which the variableвЂ™s value will be changed. Options include standard arithmetic operations as well as array operations for appending and removing values.

Value.documentation: The value used for the modification. For arithmetic operations, this is the second of two operands, with the other being the variableвЂ™s existing value. For array operations, this is the value to append or remove. Various Value Syntax can be used.

name: Modify Player Score
documentation: Modifies the score (kill count) of one or more players. This action only has an effect in free-for-all modes.

Player.documentation: The player whose score will change. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Score.documentation: The amount the score will increase or decrease. If positive, the score will increase. If negative, the score will decrease. Can use most Number based Value Syntax for this value.

name: Modify Player Variable
documentation: Modifies the value of a player variable, which is a variable that belongs to a specific player.

Player.documentation: The player whose variable will be modified. If multiple players are provided, each of their variables will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Variable.documentation: Variable specified by a single alphabetic letter (A through Z).

Operation.documentation: The way in which the variableвЂ™s value will be changed. Options include standard arithmetic operations as well as array operations for appending and removing values.

Value.documentation: The value used for the modification. For arithmetic operations, this is the second of two operands, with the other being the variableвЂ™s existing value. For array operations, this is the value to append or remove. Various Value Syntax can be used.

name: Modify Player Variable At Index
documentation: Modifies the value of a player variable at an index, which is a variable that belongs to a specific player.

Player.documentation: The player whose variable will be modified. If multiple players are provided, each of their variables will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Variable.documentation: Variable specified by a single alphabetic letter (A through Z).

Index.documentation: The index of the array to modify. If the index is beyond the end of the array, the array is extended with new elements given a value of 0.

Operation.documentation: The way in which the variableвЂ™s value will be changed. Options include standard arithmetic operations as well as array operations for appending and removing values.

Value.documentation: The value used for the modification. For arithmetic operations, this is the second of two operands, with the other being the variableвЂ™s existing value. For array operations, this is the value to append or remove. Various Value Syntax can be used.

name: Modify Team Score
documentation: Modifies the score of one or both teams. This action has not effect in free-for-all modes or modes without a team score.

Team.documentation: The team whose score will be changed. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Score.documentation: The amount the score will increase or decrease. If positive, the score will increase. If negative, the score will decrease. Can use most Number based Value Syntax for this value.

name: Pause Match Time
documentation: Pauses the match time, players, objective logic, and game mode advancement criteria are unaffected by the pause.

name: Play Effect
documentation: Plays an effect at a position in the world. The lifetime of this effect is short, so it does not need to be updated or destroyed.

Visible To.documentation: One or more players who will be able to see the effect. Can use most Value Syntax to select one or multiple players.

Type.documentation:
The type of the effect to be created.

Good Explosion
Bad Explosion
Ring Explosion
Good Pickup Effect
Bad Pickup Effect
Debuff Impact Sound
Buff Impact Sound
Ring Explosion Sound
Buff Explosion Sound
Explosion Sound

Color.documentation: The color of the effect to be created. IF a particular team is chosen, the effect will either be red or blue, depending on whether the team is hostile to the viewer.

Position.documentation: The effectвЂ™s position. If this value is a player, then the effect will move along with the player, otherwise, the value is interpreted as a position in the world. Can use most Player or Vector based Value Syntax.

Radius.documentation: The effectвЂ™s radius in meters. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

name: Preload Hero
documentation: Preemptively loads the specified hero or heroes into memory using the skins of the specified player or players, available memory permitting. Useful whenever rapid hero changing is possible and the next hero is known.

Player.documentation: The player or players who will begin preloading a hero or heroes. Only one preload hero action will be active at a time for a given player. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Hero.documentation: The hero or heroes to begin preloading for the specified player or players. When multiple heroes are specified in an array, the Heroes towards the beginning of the array are prioritized. Can use most Hero based Value Syntax for this value.

name: Press Button
documentation: Forces one or more players to press a button virtually for a single frame.

Player.documentation: The player or players for whom virtual button input will be forced. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

name: Reset Player Hero Availability
documentation: Restores the list of heroes available to one or more players to the list specified by the game settings. If a playerвЂ™s current hero becomes unavailable, the player is forced to choose a different hero and respawn at an appropriate spawn location.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose hero list is being reset. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

name: Respawn
documentation: Respawns one or more players at an appropriate spawn location with full health, even if they were already alive.

Player.documentation: The player or players to respawn. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

name: Resurrect
documentation: Instantly resurrects one or more players at the location they died with no transition.

Player.documentation: The player or players who will be resurrected. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

name: Set Ability 1 Enabled
documentation: Enables or disables ability 1 for one or more players.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose access to ability 1 is affected. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Enabled.documentation: Specifies whether the player or players are able to use ability 1. Expects a Boolean Value such as True, False, or Compare. Can use most Boolean based Value Syntax.

name: Set Ability 2 Enabled
documentation: Enables or disables ability 2 for one or more players.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose access to ability 2 is affected. Expects a Boolean Value such as True, False, or Compare. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Enabled.documentation: Specifies whether the player or players are able to use ability 2. Can use most Boolean based Value Syntax.

name: Set Aim Speed
documentation: Sets the aim speed of one or more players to a percentage of their normal aim speed.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose aim will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Turn Speed Percent.documentation: The percentage of normal aim speed to which the player or players will set their aim speed. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

name: Set Damage Dealt
documentation: Sets the damage dealt to one or more players of a percentage of their raw damage dealt. NOTE: Negative values do not heal enemies. Damage values of 0 or lower will not trigger script events.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose damage dealt will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Damage Dealt Percent.documentation: The percentage of raw damage dealt to which the player or players will set their damage dealt. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

name: Set Damage Received
documentation: Sets the damage received of one or more players to a percentage of their raw damage received. NOTE: Negative values do not heal enemies. Damage values of 0 or lower will not trigger script events.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose damage received will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

name: Set Facing
documentation: Sets the facing of one or more players to the specified direction.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose facing will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Direction.documentation:
The unit direction in which the player or players will face. This value is normalized internally. Can use most Vector based Value Syntax.
*Relative - Specifies direction is relative to world coordinates or the local coordinates of the player or players.

name: Set Global Variable
documentation: Stores a value into a global variable, which a variable that belongs to the game itself.

Variable.documentation: Specifies which Global Variable to store the value into. Specified by a single alphabetic letter (A through Z).

Value.documentation: The value that will be stored. Nearly any Value syntax can be used, however it is most common with Number based syntax.

name: Set Gravity
documentation: Sets the movement gravity for one or more players to a percentage of regular movement gravity.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose movement gravity will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax with this value.

Gravity Percent.documentation: The percentage of regular movement gravity to which the player or players will set their personal movement gravity. Can use most Number based Value Sytax with this value. 100% is the normal gravity level of the game. Less than that will decrease gravity (allowing higher jumps), higher amounts will result in higher gravity (causing shorter jumps).

name: Set Healing Dealt
documentation: Sets the healing dealt to one or more players of a percentage of their raw damage dealt. NOTE: Negative values do not damage enemies. Healing values of 0 or lower will not trigger script events.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose healing dealt will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Healing Dealt Percent.documentation: The percentage of raw healing dealt to which the player or players will set their healing dealt. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

name: Set Healing Received
documentation: Sets the healing received of one or more players to a percentage of their raw healing received. NOTE: Negative values do not damage enemies. Healing values of 0 or lower will not trigger script events.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose healing received will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Healing Received Percent.documentation: The percentage of raw healing received to which the player or players will set their healing received. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

name: Set Invisible
documentation: Causes one or more players to become invisible to either all other players or just enemies.

Player.documentation: The player or players who will become invisible. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Invisible To.documentation: Specifies for whom the player or players will be invisible. Can be set to All, Enemies, or None.

name: Set Match Time
documentation: Sets the current match time (which is visible at the top of the screen). This can be used to shorten or extend the duration of a match or to change the duration of assemble heroes or setup.

name: Set Max Health
documentation: Sets the max health of one or more players as a percentage of their raw max health. This action will ensure that a playerвЂ™s current health will not exceed the new max health.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose max health will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Health Percent.documentation: The percentage of raw max health to which the player or players will set their max health. Can use most Number based Value Syntax for this value.

name: Set Move Speed
documentation: Sets the move speed of one or more players to a percentage of their raw move speed.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose move speed will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

name: Set Objective Description
documentation: Sets the text at the top center of the screen that normally describes the objective to a message visible to specific players.

Visible To.documentation: One or more players who will see the message. Can use most Number based Player Syntax for this value.

Header.documentation: The message to be displayed. Can use most String based Value Syntax for this value.

Reevaluation.documentation: Specifies which of this actionвЂ™s inputs will be continously reevaluated. The message will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs. Can choose вЂњVisible to and StringвЂќ or вЂњStringвЂќ

name: Set Player Allowed Heroes
documentation: Sets the list of heroes available to one or more players. If a playerвЂ™s current hero becomes unavailable, the player is forced to choose a different hero and respawn at an appropriate spawn location.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose hero list is being set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Hero.documentation: The hero or heroes that will be available. If no heroes are provided, the action has no effect. Can use most Hero based Value Syntax for this value including compatible Arrays.

name: Set Player Score
documentation: Sets the score (kill count) of one or more players. This action only has an effect in free-for-all modes.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose score will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Score.documentation: The score that will be set. Can use most Number based Value Syntax for this value.

name: Set Player Variable
documentation: Stores a value into a player variable, which is a variable that belongs to a specific player.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose variable will be set. If multiple players are provided, each of their variables will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Variable.documentation: Specifies which Player Variable to store the value into. Specified by a single alphabetic letter (A through Z).

Value.documentation: The value that will be stored. Nearly any Value syntax can be used, however it is most common with Number based syntax.

name: Set Player Variable At Index
documentation: Finds or creates an array on a player variable, which is a variable that belongs to a specific player, then stores a value in the array at the specified index.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose variable will be set. If multiple players are provided, each of their variables will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Variable.documentation: Specifies which player variableвЂ™s value is the array to modify, if the variableвЂ™s value is not an array, then its value becomes an empty array. Specified by a single alphabetic letter (A through Z).

Index.documentation: The index of the array to modify. If the index is beyond the end of the array, the array is extended with the new elements given a value of zero. Can use most Number based Value Syntax with this value.

Value.documentation: The value that will be stored into the array. Nearly any Value syntax can be used, however it is most common with Number based syntax.

name: Set Primary Fire Enabled
documentation: Enables or disables primary fire for one or more players.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose access to primary fire is affected. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Enabled.documentation: Specifies whether the player or players are able to use primary fire. Expects a Boolean Value such as True, False, or Compare. Can use most Boolean based Value Syntax.

name: Set Projectile Gravity
documentation: Sets the projectile gravity for one or more players to a percentage of regular projectile gravity.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose projectile gravity will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Projectile Gravity Percent.documentation: The percentage of the regular projectile gravity to which the player or players will set their personal projectile gravity. Can use most Number based Value Syntax for this value.

name: Set Projectile Speed
documentation: Sets the projectile speed for one or more players to a percentage of regular projectile speed.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose projectile speed will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Projectile Speed Percent.documentation: The percentage of the regular projectile speed to which the player or players will set their personal projectile speed. Can use most Number based Value Syntax for this value.

name: Set Respawn Max Time
documentation: Sets the duration between death and respawn for one or more players that are already dead when this action is executed, the change takes effect on their next death.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose respawn max time will is being defined. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Time.documentation: The duration between death and respawn in seconds. Can use most Number based Value Syntax for this value.

name: Set Secondary Fire Enabled
documentation: Enables or disables secondary fire for one or more players.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose access to secondary fire is affected. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Enabled.documentation: Specifies whether the player or players are able to use secondary fire. Expects a Boolean Value such as True, False, or Compare. Can use most Boolean based Value Syntax.

name: Set Slow Motion
documentation: Sets the simulation rate for the entire game, including all players, projectiles, effects, and game mode logic.

Speed Percent.documentation: The simulation rate as a percentage of normal speed. Only rates up to 100% are allowed. Can use most Number based Value Syntax for this value.

name: Set Status
documentation: Applies a status to one or more players. This status will remain in effect for the specified duration or until it is cleared by the clear status action.

Player.documentation: The player or players to whom the status will be applied. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Assister.documentation: Specifies a player to be awarded assist credit should the affected player or players be killed while the status is in effect. An assister of null indicates no player will receive credit. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Status.documentation: The Status to be applied from the player or players. These behave similarly to statuses applied from hero abilities. Values include Hacked, Burning, Knocked Down, Asleep, Frozen, Unkillable, Invincible, Phased Out, Rooted, or Stunned.

Duration.documentation: The duration of the status effect in seconds. To have a status that lasts until a clear status action is executed, proivide an arbitrarily long duration such as 9999. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

name: Set Team Score
documentation: Sets the score for one or both teams. This action has no effect in free-for-all modes or modes without a team score.

Team.documentation: The team or teams whose score will be set. Can use most Team based Value Syntax for this value.

Score.documentation: The score that will be set. Can use most Number based Value Syntax for this value.

name: Set Ultimate Ability Enabled
documentation: Enables or disables the ultimate ability of one or more players.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose access to their ultimate ability is affected. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Enabled.documentation: Specifies whether the player or players are able to use their ultimate ability. Expects a Boolean Value such as True, False, or Compare. Can use most Boolean based Value Syntax.

name: Set Ultimate Charge
documentation: Sets the ultimate charge or one or more players as a percentage of maximum charge.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose ultimate charge will be set. Can use most Player based Value Syntax for this value.

Charge Percent.documentation: The percentage of maximum charge. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

name: Skip
documentation: Skips execution of a certain number of actions in the action list.

Number Of Actions.documentation: The number of action to skip, not including this action. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

name: Skip If
documentation: Skips execution of a certain number of actions in the action list if this actionвЂ™s condition evaluates to true. If it does not, execution continues with the next action.

Condition.documentation: Specifies whether the loop will occur. Can use most Conditional based Value Syntax for this value.

Number Of Actions.documentation: The number of action to skip, not including this action. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

name: Small Message
documentation: Displays a small message beneath the reticle that is visible to specific players.

Visible To.documentation: One or more players who will see the message. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Header.documentation: The message to be displayed. Can use most String based Value Syntax to specify.

name: Start Accelerating
documentation: Starts accelerating one or more players in a specified location.

Player.documentation: The player or players that will begin accelerating. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Direction.documentation: The unit direction in which the acceleration will be applied. This value is normalized internally. Can use most Vector based Value Syntax to specify.

Rate.documentation: The rate of acceleration in meters per second squared. This value may need to be quite high in order to overcome gravity and/or surface friction. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

Max Speed.documentation: The speed at which acceleration will stop for the player or players. It may not be possible to reach this speed due to gravity and/or surface friction. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

Relative.documentation: Specifies whether direction is relavtive to the world coordinates or the local coordinates of the player or players.

Reevaluation.documentation: Specifies which of this actions inputs will be continously reevaluated. This action will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs. You can choose from вЂњDirection, Rate, and Max SpeedвЂќ or вЂњNoneвЂќ.

name: Start Camera
documentation: Places your camera at a location, facing a direction.

Player.documentation: The player executing this rule. As specified by the event, may be the same as the attacker or the victim. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Eye Position.documentation: The position of the camrea, reevaluates continously. Can use most Vector based Value Syntax to specify.

Look At Position.documentation: Where the camera looks at, reevaluates continously. Can use most Vector based Value Syntax to specify.

Blend Speed.documentation: How fast to blend the camera movement as positions change. 0 means do not blend at all and just change positions instantly. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

name: Start Damage Modification
documentation: Starts modifying how much damage one or more receivers will receive from one or more damagers. A reference to this damage modification can be obtained from the last damage modification ID value. This action will fail if too many damage modifications have been started.

Receivers.documentation: The player or players whose incoming damage will be modified. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Damagers.documentation: The player or players whose outgoing damage will be modified (when attacking the receivers). Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Damage Percent.documentation: The percentage of damage that will apply to receivers when attacked by damagers. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to specify.

Reevaluation.documentation: Specifies which of this actionвЂ™s inputs will be continously reevaluated. This action will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs. Can choose from вЂњReceivers, Damagers, and Damage PercentвЂќ, вЂњReceivers and DamagersвЂќ, or вЂњNoneвЂќ.

name: Start Damage Over Time
documentation: Starts an instance of damage over time, this DOT will persist for the specified duration or until stopped by script. To obtain a reference to this DOT, use the last damage over time to value.

Receivers.documentation: One or more players who will receive the damage over time. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Duration.documentation: The duration of the damage over time in seconds. To have a DOT that lasts until stopped by script, provide an arbitrarily long duration such as 9999. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to specify.

Damage Per Second.documentation: The damage per second for the damage over time. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to specify.

name: Start Facing
documentation: Starts turning one or more players to face the specified direction.

Player.documentation: The player or players who will start turning. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Direction.documentation: The unit direction in which the player or players will eventually face. Can use most Vector based Value Syntax.

Turn Rate.documentation: The turn rate in degrees per second. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to specify.

Relative.documentation: Specifies whether direction is relative to the world coordinates or the local coordinates of the player or players.

Reevaluation.documentation: Specifies which of this actions inputs will be continously reevaluated. This action will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs. You can choose from вЂњDirection and Turn RateвЂќ or вЂњNoneвЂќ.

name: Start Forcing Player To Be Hero
documentation: Starts forcing one or more players to be a specified hero and, if necessary, respawns them immediately in their current locaiton. This will be the only hero available to the player or players until, the stop forcing player to be hero action is executed.

Player.documentation: The player or players who will be forced to be a specified hero. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Hero.documentation: The hero that the player or players will be forced to be. Can use most Hero based Value Syntax.

name: Start Forcing Spawn Room
documentation: Forces a team to spawn in a particular spawn room, regardless of the sapwn room normally used by the game mode. This action only has an effect in Assault, Hybrid, and Payload Maps.

Team.documentation: The team whose spawn room will be forced. Can use most Team based Value Syntax.

Room.documentation: The number of the spawn room to be forced. 0 is the first spawn room, 1 is the second, and 2 is the third. If this specified spawn room does not exist. Players will use the normal spawn room. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

name: Start Forcing Throttle
documentation: Defines minimum and maximum movement input values for one or more players. Possibly forcing or preventing movement.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose movement whill be forced or limited. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Min Forward.documentation: Sets the minimum run forward amount. 0 allows the player or players to stop while 1 forces full forward movement. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

Max Forward.documentation: Sets the maximum run forward amount. 0 allows the player or players to stop while 1 forces full forward movement. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

Min Backward.documentation: Sets the minimum run backward amount. 0 allows the player or players to stop while 1 forces full forward movement. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

Max Backward.documentation: Sets the maximum run backward amount. 0 allows the player or players to stop while 1 forces full forward movement. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

Min Sideways.documentation: Sets the minimum run sideways amount. 0 allows the player or players to stop while 1 forces full forward movement. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

name: Start Heal Over Time
documentation: Starts an instance of damage over time, this HOT will persist for the specified duration or until stopped by script. To obtain a reference to this HOT, use the last damage over time to value.

Player.documentation: One or more players who will receive the heal over time. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Healer.documentation: The player who will receive credit for the heal. A damager of null indicates no player will receive credit. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Duration.documentation: The duration of the heal over time in seconds. To have a HOT that lasts until stopped by script, provide an arbitrarily long duration such as 9999. Can use most Number based Value Syntax to specify.

name: Start Holding Button
documentation: Forces one or more players to hold a button virtually until stopped by the stop holding button action.

Player.documentation: The player or players who are holding a button virtually. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Button.documentation: The logical button that is being held virtually.

name: Start Throttle In Direction
documentation: Sets or adds to the throttle (directional input control) of a player or players such that they begin moving in a particular direction. Any previous throttle in direction is cancelled.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose throttle will be set or added to.

Direction.documentation: The unit direction in which the throttle will be set or added to. This value is normalized internally.

Magnitude.documentation: The amount of throttle (or change to throttle). A value of 1 denotes full throttle.

Relative.documentation: Specifies whether direction is relative to world coordinates or the local coordinates of the player or players.

Behavior.documentation: Specifies whether preexisting throttle is replaced or added to.

Reevaluation.documentation: Specifies which of this actionвЂ™s inputs will be continously reevaluated. This action will keep asking for and using new values from reevaluated inputs.

name: Start Transforming Throttle
documentation: Starts transforming (scaling and rotating) the throttle (directional input control) of a player or players. Cancels any existing START TRANSFORMING THROTTLE behavior.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose throttle will be transformed.

X Axis Scalar.documentation: The player or players will have their throttle X Axis (Left to Right) multiplied by this value before the throttle is rotated to its new relative direction. This value is evaluated continously (meaning it updates every frame).

Y Axis Scalar.documentation: The player or players will have their throttle Y Axis (Front to Back) multiplied by this value before the throttle is rotated to its new relative direction. This value is evaluated continously (meaning it updates every frame).

Relative Direction.documentation: After the axis scalars are applied, the player or players will have their throttle transformed so that it is relative to this unit direction vector. For Example, to make the throttle camera relative, provide the direction that the camera is facing. This value is evaluated continously (meaning it updates every frame) and normalized internally.

name: Stop Accelerating
documentation: Stops the acceleration started by the start accelerating action for one or more players.

Player.documentation: The player or players who will stop accelerating. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

name: Stop All Damage Modifications
documentation: Stops the all damage modifications that were started using the start damage modification action.

name: Stop All Damage Over Time
documentation: Stops all damage over time started by the start damage over time or one or more players.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose scripted damage over time will stop. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

name: Stop All Heal Over Time
documentation: Stops all heal over time started by the start heal over time or one or more players.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose scripted heal over time will stop. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

name: Stop Camera
documentation: Stops all forced camera positions started by the start camera or one or more players.

Player.documentation: The player or players whose forced camera positions will stop. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

name: Stop Chasing Global Variable
documentation: Stops an in-progress chase of a global variable, leaving it at its current value.

Variable.documentation: Specifies which global variable to stop modifying. Specified by a single alphabetic letter (A through Z).

name: Stop Chasing Player Variable
documentation: Stops an in-progress chase of a player variable, leaving it at its current value.

Player.documentation: The player whose variable will stop changing. If multiple players are provided, each of their variables will stop changing. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Variable.documentation: Specifies which player variable to stop modifying. Specified by a single alphabetic letter (A through Z).

name: Stop Damage Modification
documentation: Stops a damage modification that was started by the start damage modification action

Damage modification ID.documentation: Specifies which damage modification instance to stop, this ID may be the last damage modification ID or a variable into which last damage modification ID was earlier stored. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

name: Stop Damage Over Time
documentation: Stops an instance of damage over time that was started by the start damage over time action

Damage Over Time ID.documentation: Specifies which damage over time instance to stop, this ID may be the last damage over time ID or a variable into which last damage over time ID was earlier stored. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

name: Stop Facing
documentation: Stops the turning started by the start facing action for or one or more players.

Player.documentation: The player or players who will stop turning. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

name: Stop Forcing Player To Be Hero
documentation: Stops forcing one or more players to be a specified hero. This will not respawn the player or players, but it will restore their availablity the next time they go to select a hero.

Player.documentation: The player or players who will no longer be forced to be a specific hero. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

name: Stop Forcing Spawn Room
documentation: Undoes the effect of start forcing spawn room action for the specified team.

Team.documentation: The team that will resume using their normal spawn room. Can use most Team based Value Syntax.

name: Stop Forcing Throttle
documentation: Undoes the effect of start forcing throttle action for one or more players

Player.documentation: The player or players whose movement inout will be restored. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

name: Stop Heal Over Time
documentation: Stops an instance of heal over time that was started by the start heal over time action

name: Stop Holding Button
documentation: Undoes the effect of the start holding button action for one or more players.

Player.documentation: The player or players who are no longer holding a button virtually. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

name: Stop Throttle In Direction
documentation: Cancels the behavior caused by START THROTTLE IN DIRECTION.

name: Stop Transforming Throttle
documentation: Stops the throttle transform started by START TRANSFORMING THROTTLE for one or more players.

name: Teleport
documentation: Teleports one or more players to the specified location.

Player.documentation: The player or players to teleport. Can use most Player based Value Syntax.

Position.documentation: The position to which the player or players will teleport. If a player is providedm the position of the player is used. Can use most Vector based Value Syntax.

name: Unpause Match Time
documentation: Unpauses the match time.

name: Wait
documentation: Pauses the execution of the action list, unless the wait is interrupted. The remainder of the actions will execute after the pause.

Time.documentation: The duration of the pause. A minimum value of 0.250 seconds is required. Can use most Number based Value Syntax.

Wait Behavior.documentation: Specifies if and how the wait can be interrupted. If the condition list is ignored, the wait will not be interrupted, otherwise, the condition list will determine if and when the action list will abort or restart.

name: Remove All Health Pools From Player
Destroy All Progress Bar HUD Text
Destroy All Progress Bar In-World Text

Player.documentation: The Player or Players who will have their voice chat disabled.

Team Voice Chat.documentation: Whether or not Team Voice Chat will be disabled.

Match Voice Chat.documentation: Whether or not Match Voice Chat will be disabled.

Group Voice Chat.documentation: Whether or not Group Voice Chat will be disabled.
